channel.title: No audio out in patcher
channel.description:
hi,
i had my board for a long time on a shelf i am running into a new project soon where my axoloti can become a good tool today, i installed the latest software (windows 10 version 2.0.0.0) i plugged the bord in my pc by usb and it did an automatic flash upgrade the main axoloti screen tels me the input is active when i open an new patch i see the inputs (audio/inconfig I) but not the outputs the board > select device tells me " Axoloti core :1:1 not accesseable: -12 and busy? " any idea someone ?
thanks,
w.

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @planktone
item.description:
@planktone wrote:

ok,

i upgraded it today again to version 2
as in the 1.version AXLOTI appears in the "game" part of the devices, not in the "audio"
when i upgrade i get one red remark

C:\Program Files (x86)\Axoloti\app\env/test-env.mk:25: *** Compiler not found. Stop.
error: compiler arm-none-eabi-g++ not found in path=C:\Program Files (x86)\Axoloti\app/platformwin/bin;C:/Program Files (x86)/GNU Tools Arm Embedded/7 2018-q2-update/bin;, not installed?_
Please download and install GNU Arm Embedded Toolchain 7-2018-q2-update

at the end

Firmware flashing in progress, do not unplug the board until the leds stop blinking! You can connect again after the leds stop blinking.
USB device found
not accesseable : -12
USB device found
USB device found
not accesseable : -12
USB device found
connected
Authentic Axoloti Core
Firmware version: 2.0.0.0, crc=0xCDEEEFDA

but, board runs fin with version 1

w.

Read full topic

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @jaimun jaimun
item.description:
@jaimun wrote:

True, I checked on my system... I thought it was working as a windows audio device when in Live mode.

Read full topic

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

yes, that comment was in response to @jaimun s comment

Read full topic

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @planktone
item.description:
@planktone wrote:

...

I don’t try to use my board as windows audio interface, i want to use it as an independent unit after programming.
It works great in version 1 not in version 2
I see in the patcher the inputs and they are working, not the outputs
When i ask to activate them, axoloti tells me “-12” and “bussy?” In the second line
During install of the version 2 patcher software, the upgrade of the axoloti firmware was done on request

Meanwhile my board is running online as a first test of a random station at http://planktone.be/plankstroom ( not on iOS )

W.

Read full topic

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

axoloti has no audio capabilities over usb, so windows will not see an audio in/out

Read full topic

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @jaimun jaimun
item.description:
@jaimun wrote:

Maybe, Win takes control of the output as it's default device, so it is unavalaible to other software. It's happened to me with many audiocards and Win10.

Read full topic

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @planktone
item.description:
@planktone wrote:

yes, this did the trick ...
hope V2 becomes soon working available
thx
w.

Read full topic

item.title: No audio out in patcher
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

I am not sure about your specific problem, but I would highly recommend to downgrade to version 1.0.12.

Version 2.0 is still being developed. I tried installing it once and only had problems and went back to 1.0.12, right away. In version 2 there is the option to downgrade to 1.0.12 directly from the editor.

Read full topic

hi,

i had my board for a long time on a shelf
i am running into a new project soon where my axoloti can become a good tool
